commit_message:
Handle getattrs to ConfigOpts for deprecated opts

There are libraries and tools which offer their config interface as
a stable backwards compatible interface both in code and as user
facing interface. A vital part of being able to make changes to this
is to handle deprecation and moving options. While oslo.config offers
a fairly rich deprecation mechanism it only exposes itself on the
user facing side. If a project wishes to deprecate an option for
code consumers who wish to use the config definitions externally they
will break by any change that deprecates an option. This commit fixes
this issue by doing a lookup on the deprecated options as a fallback
on a getattr. This way if an option is not found all the deprecated
options are checked, if a matching deprecated opt is found a warning
is logged and it's value is used.

Change-Id: I6e28c25f04273f7def486fadd541babc8cf423cb
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/oslo.config refs/changes/87/357987/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def _get_deprecated_opts(self, group=None): """Return a dict of all the deprecated opt objects group by name Helper function to get a dict of all the deprecated_opts where the key is the parent undeprecated opt and the value is a list of all the deprecated opts. If a group is specified the results are limited to deprecated options in that group. :param str group: the group to limit the results to. :returns: deprecated opts :rtype: dict """ deprecated_opts_dict = {} for opt in self._opts: if hasattr(self._opts[opt]['opt'], 'deprecated_opts'): deprecated_opts = self._opts[opt]['opt'].deprecated_opts if group is None: deprecated_opts_dict[opt] = deprecated_opts else: group_dep_opts = [] for dep_opt in deprecated_opts: if group is dep_opt.group: group_dep_opts.append(dep_opt) deprecated_opts_dict[opt] = group_dep_opts return deprecated_opts_dict deprecated_opts = self._get_deprecated_opts() deprecated_opts = self._get_deprecated_opts(group=group) if opt_name not in opts and not deprecated_opts: elif opt_name not in opts and deprecated_opts: real_opt_name = None real_group_name = None for opt in deprecated_opts: for dep_opt in deprecated_opts[opt]: if opt_name == dep_opt.name: real_opt_name = opt real_group_name = self._opts[opt]['opt'].group break if real_opt_name is not None: break else: raise NoSuchOptError(opt_name, group) dep_message = _LW('Config option %(dep_group)s.%(dep_option)s ' ' is deprecated. Use option %(group)s.' '%(option)s instead.') LOG.warning(dep_message, {'dep_option': opt_name, 'dep_group': group, 'option': real_opt_name, 'group': real_group_name}) opt_name = real_opt_name

subject: Fix db_version checking for sqlalchemy-migrate
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-04-13 01:29:52.000000000', 'files': ['oslo_db/tests/sqlalchemy/test_migration_common.py', 'oslo_db/sqlalchemy/migration.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/oslo.db/commit/8eda40da25da2a05c19f9e68a3973986e4a38320', 'message': "Fix db_version checking for sqlalchemy-migrate

When a project has multiple migration repos and
oslo_db.sqlalchemy.migration.db_version() is called using the one
repo as the abs_path, it will attempt to put the repo under version
control. The next time it's called with the other abs_path, it would
fail rather than attempting to put the repo under version control
when using sqlalchemy-migrate. When using alembic, db_version would
attempt to put the new abs_path under version control.

This change makes it so that when sqlalchemy-migrate is used
db_version() will attempt to version control the new abs_path just
like when alembic is used.

Change-Id: If5e2ae1a72f9118c7aca34e925fdc5e3e8480275
"}]
commit_message:
Fix db_version checking for sqlalchemy-migrate

When a project has multiple migration repos and
oslo_db.sqlalchemy.migration.db_version() is called using the one
repo as the abs_path, it will attempt to put the repo under version
control. The next time it's called with the other abs_path, it would
fail rather than attempting to put the repo under version control
when using sqlalchemy-migrate. When using alembic, db_version would
attempt to put the new abs_path under version control.

This change makes it so that when sqlalchemy-migrate is used
db_version() will attempt to version control the new abs_path just
like when alembic is used.

Change-Id: If5e2ae1a72f9118c7aca34e925fdc5e3e8480275

commit_message:
Container logs is not good user experience

Zun only supports stdout and stderr arguments,
users need more options like tail, since, time period etc.

Change-Id: I150e9c1bd8e4099d575624b1e0cbed7b00f63c35
Closes-Bug: #1667182

deleted_lines: def logs(self, id, stdout, stderr): if stdout is False and stderr is False: stdout = True stderr = True qparams={'stdout': stdout, 'stderr': stderr})[1]

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-03-02 10:46:14.000000000', 'files': ['masakari/tests/unit/compute/test_nova.py', 'masakari/conf/nova.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/masakari/commit/3f67b04e2158856f69ec5c0aee3672c7b9933ed8', 'message': 'Change nova_catalog_admin_info to default to publicURL

This patch changes the default for the nova_catalog_admin_info to be

Closes-Bug: #1669280
Change-Id: I90bc214249f8a542f2d40fca544af204e0665821

commit_message:
Change nova_catalog_admin_info to default to publicURL

A recent change in devstack [1] reduced the number of endpoints
configured by default. This breaks masakari resulting into:
"EndpointNotFound: adminURL endpoint for compute service not found"

This patch changes the default for the nova_catalog_admin_info to be
the normal 'publicURL'. With 'publicURL' masakari-engine is able to
call nova's admin restricted apis.

[1] Ided7a65c81b3a0b56f0184847fc82e17c29a771e
Closes-Bug: #1669280
Change-Id: I90bc214249f8a542f2d40fca544af204e0665821
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/masakari refs/changes/29/440329/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Update to a newer hacking library

The older hacking library has a cap on pbr <2.0, with the recent 2.0.0
release of PBR it's causing failures in the pep8 job. hacking isn't
kept in sync via the typical proposal-bot updates. Do it manually to
clear the gate issue.

Please see gate logs for reference:
http://logs.openstack.org/31/406931/1/check/gate-masakari-pep8-ubuntu-xenial/1e8b199/console.html

Related-Bug: #1668848
Change-Id: I5fd77ca87266034c42dae59fd28ede7f6b9dd382
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/masakari refs/changes/22/440322/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Install nova-placement package on upgrade

This doesn't exist in newton images, so install it via the
ansible tasks during step3 (when all other packages are updated).

Change-Id: I08fb7855b910ccc5a8ab2d73f1de15b695784abd
Closes-Bug: #1664265
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/39/435339/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-03-02 10:01:22.000000000', 'files': ['keystone/tests/unit/test_v3_assignment.py', 'keystone/tests/unit/assignment/test_backends.py', 'keystone/tests/unit/test_v3_auth.py', 'keystone/assignment/core.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/keystone/commit/2cb842cd645cbfcad4ccd62200340ce4616a8aa7', 'message': 'Removing group role assignments results in overly broad revocation events

When a role on a group scoped to project/domain is revoked, it persists
revocation event in revoke_event table which is invalidating all tokens
created with same role in project/domain. Since token validations are happening
by populating role assignments at validation time, the need for persistence of
revocation events is no longer needed.

Change-Id: I112d5d4684f739d320606cea651e0a108f18d245
Closes-Bug: #1662514
'}]
commit_message:
Removing group role assignments results in overly broad revocation events

When a role on a group scoped to project/domain is revoked, it persists
revocation event in revoke_event table which is invalidating all tokens
created with same role in project/domain. Since token validations are happening
by populating role assignments at validation time, the need for persistence of
revocation events is no longer needed.

Change-Id: I112d5d4684f739d320606cea651e0a108f18d245
Closes-Bug: #1662514
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/keystone refs/changes/81/440281/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

deleted_lines: self.revoke_api.revoke_by_grant(user_id=user_id, role_id=role_id, domain_id=domain_id, project_id=project_id) # Group may contain a lot of users so revocation will be # by role & domain/project if domain_id is None: self.revoke_api.revoke_by_project_role_assignment( project_id, role_id ) else: self.revoke_api.revoke_by_domain_role_assignment( domain_id, role_id )

commit_message:
[poc] add some code to reject known bad filters.

In order to achieve the goal of:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/408571/
we should reject the known bad filters.

This patch include two methods of doing this:
1. Add a decorator to remove the known bad filters
either by a list of filters or according to a
regex.

2. Add a new format and use JSON Schema to
do the job.

We can choose one of the approach and easily
get rid of the other one.

Change-Id: I260cbf50151633574b4865081b27d7fa7084801f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/56/419256/6 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import refrom nova import exception from nova.i18n import _ def reject_known_bad_filters(filters_to_reject, patterns_to_reject=None, min_version=None, max_version=None): """Reject known bad filters in request query parameters. :param list filters_to_reject: a list of known bad filters that should be rejected. :param min_version: A string of two numerals. X.Y indicating the minimum version of the JSON-Schema to validate against. :param max_version: A string of two numerals. X.Y indicating the maximum version of the JSON-Schema against to. """ def add_validator(func): @functools.wraps(func) def wrapper(*args, **kwargs): # The request object is always the second argument. # However numerous unittests pass in the request object # via kwargs instead so we handle that as well. # TODO(cyeoh): cleanup unittests so we don't have to # to do this if 'req' in kwargs: req = kwargs['req'] else: req = args[1] _filters_rejection_helper(filters_to_reject, patterns_to_reject, req.GET.dict_of_lists(), min_version, max_version, args, kwargs) return func(*args, **kwargs) return wrapper return add_validator def _filters_rejection_helper(filters_to_reject, patterns_to_reject, target, min_version, max_version, args, kwargs,): """A helper method to execute JSON-Schema Validation. This method checks the request version whether matches the specified max version and min_version. It also takes a care of legacy v2 request. If the version range matches the request, we validate the schema against the target and a failure will result in a ValidationError being raised. :param schema: A dict, the JSON-Schema is used to validate the target. :param target: A dict, the target is validated by the JSON-Schema. :param min_version: A string of two numerals. X.Y indicating the minimum version of the JSON-Schema to validate against. :param max_version: A string of two numerals. X.Y indicating the maximum version of the JSON-Schema to validate against. :param args: Positional arguments which passed into original method. :param kwargs: Keyword arguments which passed into original method. :param is_body: A boolean. Indicating whether the target is HTTP request body or not. :returns: A boolean. `True` if and only if the version range matches the request AND the schema is successfully validated. `False` if the version range does not match the request and no validation is performed. :raises: ValidationError, when the validation fails. """ min_ver = api_version.APIVersionRequest(min_version) max_ver = api_version.APIVersionRequest(max_version) pattern_regexes = [] for regex in patterns_to_reject: pattern_regexes.append(re.compile(regex)) rejected_params = [] # The request object is always the second argument. # However numerous unittests pass in the request object # via kwargs instead so we handle that as well. # TODO(cyeoh): cleanup unittests so we don't have to # to do this if 'req' in kwargs: ver = kwargs['req'].api_version_request legacy_v2 = kwargs['req'].is_legacy_v2() else: ver = args[1].api_version_request legacy_v2 = args[1].is_legacy_v2() if legacy_v2: # NOTE: For v2.0 compatible API, here should work like # client | schema min_version | schema # -----------+--------------------+-------- # legacy_v2 | None | work # legacy_v2 | 2.0 | work # legacy_v2 | 2.1+ | don't if min_version is None or min_version == '2.0': for param in target.keys(): if (param in filters_to_reject or list(regex for regex in pattern_regexes if regex.match(param))): rejected_params.append(param) return True elif ver.matches(min_ver, max_ver): # Only validate against the schema if it lies within # the version range specified. Note that if both mi # and max are not specified the validator will always # be run. for param in target.keys(): if param in filters_to_reject: if (param in filters_to_reject or list(regex for regex in pattern_regexes if regex.match(param))): rejected_params.append(param) return True if rejected_params: rejected_params = ", ".join(rejected_params) detail = _("Invalid input for query parameters. " "Values: %s.") % rejected_params raise exception.ValidationError(detail=detail)

commit_message:
Added printing exit code of component process if it failed to start

When command failed and component failed to start, original exit code
was overwritten due to original command being executed in background.
This commit adds information about command's exit code to echoed message
about component's start up failure.

Change-Id: I8a3dd485b1b1f2d70d42c5610baac7c0c713f53a
Signed-off-by: Joanna Taryma <joanna.taryma@intel.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack refs/changes/40/429840/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: screen -S $SCREEN_NAME -p $name -X stuff "$command & echo \$! >$SERVICE_DIR/$SCREEN_NAME/${name}.pid; fg || echo \"$name failed to start. Exit code: $?\" | tee \"$SERVICE_DIR/$SCREEN_NAME/${name}.failure\"$NL"
deleted_lines: screen -S $SCREEN_NAME -p $name -X stuff "$command & echo \$! >$SERVICE_DIR/$SCREEN_NAME/${name}.pid; fg || echo \"$name failed to start\" | tee \"$SERVICE_DIR/$SCREEN_NAME/${name}.failure\"$NL"

commit_message:
Add allow_global_implied_dsr_disabled feature flag

This patch enabled the "allow_global_implied_dsr_disabled" feature
flag. This is a feature flag toggle for bug 1590578 which is fixed
in Newton and Ocata. This option can be removed after Mitaka is
end of life.

Change-Id: I70e3ce79ee6d9b00cc48bb178bd423d0196f6588
Related-Bug: #1590578

commit_message:
Change rebuild tests to use image_ref

Some tests fail incorrectly if image_ref_alt is null, they should
use image_ref instead, as that's going to be filled in.

Change-Id: I4df2175ecf0fe231e29332cfb48c12d20e36b527
Closes-Bug: #1664291

commit_message:
Container logs is not good user experience

Zun only supports stdout and stderr arguments,
users need more options like tail, since, time period etc.

Change-Id: Ief098721f80658361aa0c0e80dabdd6dc8fd58e9
Closes-Bug: #1667182
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-zunclient refs/changes/53/438453/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def logs(self, id, stdout, stderr, timestamps, tail, since, follow): 'stderr': stderr, 'timestamps': timestamps, 'tail': tail, 'since': since, 'follow': follow})[1]
deleted_lines: def logs(self, id, stdout, stderr): 'stderr': stderr})[1]

commit_message:
Fetch trunk port MTU only on trunk validation

During subport removal (when trunk validation is False) we do
not need to fetch the MTU.

TrivialFix

Change-Id: I9201e33fdc7da5a6aa45135d9531d65c92d83b12

commit_message:
Use tempest.lib's TimeoutException

TimeoutException is defined in tempest.lib.exceptions like
https://github.com/openstack/tempest/blob/master/tempest/lib/exceptions.py#L139
Then this patch makes network_client use the exception.

Change-Id: I9b7a40e8cbcb239eb983c3418e5e2ea723a5b523
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron-lbaas refs/changes/15/439115/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
deleted_lines: from tempest import exceptions raise exceptions.TimeoutException raise exceptions.TimeoutException(message)
